readability_reflection: Concatenation was more readable to me as it clearly defined exactly what is a word and what is a variable. Example: "Hello " + World, I can clearly tell world is a variable at first glance where "Hello {World}" is tougher to tell on first glance.
comprehension_debugging: Yes, as whether or not I am able to quickly interpret what I am reading is better so I don't get confused and end up debugging the wrong thing.
preference_rationale: I would choose concatenation as it is much easier to write and read for me, and though it makes statements longer is improves readability a lot. I also believe using a + sign makes much more sense to append to a string rather than {}.
learning_curve: I am much more familiar with concatenation so I suppose it made it much easier for me to understand them. I am also used to math so a + symbol was more familiar to me.
suggestions_improvement: I think interpolation could use a bit more denotation to show it is a variable, for example "Hello {{World}}" makes it much more clear, though it might be harder to write.
